alert.note: Alert for Yavapai County Mountains; Yavapai County Valleys and Basins (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 11:16AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT AREAS NEAR PRESCOTT IN YAVAPAI COUNTY THROUGH 1145 AM MST... At 1115 AM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Prescott Gateway Mall, moving north at 10 to 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, heavy rain, and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Heavy rainfall will result in minor flooding. Locations impacted include... Chino Valley, Prescott Valley, Prescott, Groom Creek Subdivision, Prescott Airport, Walker, Williamson Valley, Prescott Gateway Mall, Yavapai County Fairgrounds, Downtown Prescott, Oak Knoll Village, Lynx Lake Dam, and Prescott Valley Event Center. This includes the following highways... State Route 89 between mile markers 311 and 329. State Route 89A between mile markers 318 and 327. State Route 69 between mile markers 286 and 296. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to minor flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
